attributes.action: introduce legislation allowing citizens to trigger referendums on national or local issues
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: British citizens should be able to trigger referendums on any issue where 2.5% of the population have signed a petition - for a national issue this would mean one million signatures and for a local ballot around 3-4,000.  Such a system - called Citizens' Initiatives - already operates in Switzerland, New Zealand, Hungary and 24 states in America.
